lines.text: You've done such magnificent work. And that's what makes it so difficult to send you away. But I must.
Well, this is an idea. I think I'd make a swell nurse.
Behave...
Just think of the thrill. Holding hands all night with good-looking sick officers.
And can you imagine moonlights nights at no-man's land. Oh, boy.
Yeah, with a general on each arm.
You know, with that it would have it on Paris. They've commandeered our cars and left nothing but 80-year old men on the boulevards.
You, said it! With five million men up there, that's our place, darling.
Hooray.
Thanks. You're sure its alright?
Looks perfect to me.
I'd never forgive myself if I was out of commission for tonight.
Oh, that's alright. I don't care about dancing anyway.
Dancing? I'm on night duty, tonight.
Yeah, that's what I mean.
And if I wasn't, I'd be sleeping.
Gee, its wonderful the way you get all of my ideas.
Funny the way the men have changed. They used to talk about what they'd do when the war was over and things like that.
Yeah, now all they talk about is women.
Yes, women. It seems to be the only thing the men are interested in. Why even the youngsters are so afraid they'll die before they've ever lived.
Well, it makes me awfully nervous the way they always want to look at you and touch you. Why, even the doctors are getting so...
Well, even the doctors are human, I suppose.
Are you going to get married?
Well, he hasn't said anything about that, yet; but, I know he will. Maybe on his next leave. Oh, it will be so wonderful. Don't you want to get married?
I should say not. I've had enough war.
You know girls, I was always told it would be disgraceful to see a man undress.
Well, I've watched so many naked men lately that I'm ready to go live with the eskimos. They only undress once a year!
